lines.content: * Class for the command that adds a task into the tasklist.
* @param ipt the string representation of the command input.
* Indicates whether this is an exit command.
* The task will be parsed from the input string representation and added into the task list.
* The text file will be updated with the given task.
* A completion message will be displayed after successful execution.
* @param tasks tasklist that stores all the tasks
* @param ui ui object that deals with user interaction
* @param storage storage object that deals with writing into the text file
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
throw new DukeException("The description of the deadline is incorrect.");
throw new DukeException("The description of the event is incorrect.");
throw new DukeException("The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
ui.showResultOfCommand("     Got it. I've added this task: \n       "
+ tk + "\n     Now you have " + tasks.getNumOfTask() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new DukeException("I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
ui.showError("I'm sorry, but the datetime format is incorrect :-(");
* Abstract class for a command to be executed when the user inputs a command.
abstract public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException;
* Contains a description of the task and the datetime for which it is due.
* Initializes the description and due datetime.
* @param by datetime for which the deadline is due.
* Getter for the description of the deadline task.
* @return the string of the description of the deadline.
* Returns the string representation of the deadline task.
* @return string consisting of the type of task (deadline), done marker, description and due date and time.
* Class for the command that deletes a task from the tasklist.
* @param taskNum the index of the task to be deleted
* Indicates whether this is an exit command.
* Given task will be deleted from the tasklist at the index position.
* A completion message will be displayed after successful deletion.
* @param tasks tasklist that stores all the tasks
* @param ui ui object that deals with user interaction
* @param storage storage object that deals with writing into the text file
* @throws DukeException exception is thrown when the index falls outside the number of tasks
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("List only has " + tasks.getNumOfTask() + " items.");
ui.showResultOfCommand("     Noted. I've removed this task:\n       " + curTask
+ "\n     Now you have " + tasks.getNumOfTask() + " tasks in the list.");
* Class for the command that marks a given task done given its index.
* @param taskNum the index of the task to be marked done.
* Indicates whether this is an exit command.
* Given task will be marked done from the tasklist at the index position.
* A completion message will be displayed after successful deletion.
* @param tasks tasklist that stores all the tasks
* @param ui ui object that deals with user interaction
* @param storage storage object that deals with writing into the text file
* @throws DukeException exception is thrown when the index falls outside the number of tasks
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("List only has " + tasks.getNumOfTask() + " items.");
ui.showResultOfCommand("     Nice! I've marked this task as done: \n     " + curTask);
* A CLI program that tracks a lists of tasks.
* Capable of adding, deleting and listing tasks.
* Initializes the Ui, Storage and Tasklist.
* @param filePath The file path of the txt file Duke loads and writes the task lists to.
* It successively reads the command input given by the user until the exit command is given.
* Class that represents an exception thrown when Duke encounters an invalid command.
* Contains a description of the task and the datetime on which the event starts.
* @param at date and time on which the event starts.
* Getter for the description of the event task.
* @return the string of the description of the event.
* Returns the string representation of the event.
* @return string consisting of the type of task (event), done marker, description and due date and time.
* Class for the command that prompts the program to terminate.
* Indicates whether this is an exit command.
* Prints the bye message through the Ui object.
* @param tasks tasklist that stores all the tasks
* @param ui ui object that deals with user interaction
* @param storage storage object that deals with writing into the text file
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showResultOfCommand("     Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Class that represents the find command.
* @param ipt the string of search query.
* Indicates if the command is the exit command.
* Searches within the tasklist if any of the tasks match the search query.
* @param tasks tasklist that stores all the tasks
* @param ui ui object that deals with user interaction
* @param storage storage object that deals with writing into the text file
* @throws DukeException exception is thrown when no task is found.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
StringBuilder stringOfTasksFound = new StringBuilder("     Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n");
* Class for the command that prompts the program to terminate.
* Indicates whether this is an exit command.
* All tasks in the tasklist will be displayed to the user.
* Tasks are represented by their string representation.
* @param tasks tasklist that stores all the tasks
* @param ui ui object that deals with user interaction
* @param storage storage object that deals with writing into the text file
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
StringBuilder stringOfItems = new StringBuilder("     Here are the tasks in your list:\n");
* Class that handles the loading and writing of tasks from/to a text file in the hard drive.
* @param fp string representation of the file path from the project source directory.
* Updates the textfile with the latest tasklist by rewriting the entire tasklist.
* @param tasks tasklist that represents all the current tasks in the tasklist.
* Loads the tasklist from the textfile in the hard drive.
* @return an arraylist consisting of the tasks parsed.
* @throws FileNotFoundException exception thrown when the text file cannot be found.
* Class for a task in Duke.
* Consists of the description of the task and a marker to indicate if it is done.
* Initializes the description and done marker for the task.
* Task is initialized as not done by default.
* @param des the description of the task
* Returns whether the task is done or not
* @return boolean flag indicating whether the task is done or not
* Getter for the description of the task.
* @return the string of the description of the task.
* Returns the string representation of the task.
* @return string consisting of done marker and description of the task.
* Class that represents the tasklist that holds all the tasks in Duke.
* The tasklist will be initialized with all the tasks in the given list.
* @param ls tasklist to be initialized with.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* @return int of the number of tasks in the list.
* Returns a task given its index.
* @param idx index of the task to be returned.
* @return the task represented by its index.
* Returns the tasklist in an ArrayList.
* Deletes a tast in the tasklist.
* @param idx index of the task to be deleted.
* Adds a task into the list.
* @param tk task to be added into the list.
* Contains a description of the task and the datetime for which it is due.
* Returns the string representation of the todo task.
* @return string consisting of the type of task (todo), done marker, description and due date and time.
* Class for the Ui (User Interaction) object.
* Handles all user input and program output to the user.
* Inserts a line above and below the input string.
* @param input input string to be sandwiched by lines.
* @return string consisting of the input and two lines, above and below the string
* Prints the welcome message to the user.
System.out.println(insertLines("     Hello! I'm Duke\n" + "     What can I do for you?"));
* Parses the command given by the user.
* @return Command object that specifies what command the user has given.
* @throws DukeException exception is thrown when the command cannot be found or does not meet its specifications.
* Displays the successful completion message after the completion of a command.
* @param msg completion message to be printed
* Displays the error message whenever a error is found.
* @param msg error message to be printed.
* Displays the loading error whenever the text file in which Duke reads and writes from cannot be opened.
System.out.println(insertLines("      OOPS!!! The file cannot be opened"));
